dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, you know we often talk about, like, what makes a *great* workplace, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, you know we often talk about, like, what makes a great workplace, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. The dream jobs, the companies everyone wants to work for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. The dream jobs, the companies everyone wants to work for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But what about the *other* side of the coin? The places where people are, uh, not so happy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But what about the other side of the coin? The places where people are, uh, not so happy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, you mean the CareerBliss list! I saw that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, you mean the CareerBliss list! I saw that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Their annual list of the least happy companies. And, I mean, some of the names on here are, like, really surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Their annual list of the least happy companies. And, I mean, some of the names on here are, like, really surprising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Careers site CareerBliss launched its eighth-annual list of the happiest companies in America.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, tell me about it. Who, uh, who topped the list for the wrong reasons?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, tell me about it. Who, uh, who topped the list for the wrong reasons?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Keller Williams Realty. Bottom of the list. Apparently, employees feel, like, penalized for seeking different career paths internally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Keller Williams Realty. Bottom of the list. Apparently, employees feel, like, penalized for seeking different career paths internally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Keller Williams Realty takes the top spot. ... A Keller Williams Realty employee wrote on CareerBliss.com, One of the greatest benefits is how our company promotes from within. All employees are encouraged and supported to be in control of their growth and career paths.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a pretty big red flag, isn't it? Discouraging internal growth?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a pretty big red flag, isn't it? Discouraging internal growth?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then, get this: Nike is second to last. Nike!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then, get this: Nike is second to last. Nike!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nike? Really? Even with all their, um, big direct-to-consumer push?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nike? Really? Even with all their, um, big direct to consumer push?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And Adobe, the tech giant behind PDFs, is fourth-unhappiest. Employees called the atmosphere "highly competitive and isolating."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And Adobe, the tech giant behind P D Fs, is fourth unhappiest. Employees called the atmosphere highly competitive and isolating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adobe is the fourth happiest company, according to CareerBliss. ... The atmosphere is highly collaborative and energizing. People have always been friendly and helpful; very professional, wrote one employee on CareerBliss.com.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, that sounds tough. And Amgen, the pharma company, apparently has awful work-life balance. No daycare, slow co-workers, and even employees feeling bad about the "negative impact" they made on patients' lives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, that sounds tough. And Amgen, the pharma company, apparently has awful work life balance. No daycare, slow co workers, and even employees feeling bad about the negative impact they made on patients lives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The work-life balance is great, fantastic daycare on campus, lots of smart co-workers, wrote one CareerBliss reviewer. Working for Amgen was very rewarding to see the positive impact we made in patients lives, reported a West Coast employee.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just wild, you know? These are huge, successful companies, but their employee experience is just, uh, completely missing the mark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just wild, you know? These are huge, successful companies, but their employee experience is just, uh, completely missing the mark.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It totally makes me think about that Parnassus Endeavor fund, too. The one investing in companies with 'positive workplace ratings.' They've struggled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It totally makes me think about that Parnassus Endeavor fund, too. The one investing in companies with positive workplace ratings. They've struggled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, a mutual fund that invests in companies with positive workplace ratings, Parnassus Endeavor, has beaten the market handily over the past 10 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, if even the 'good' ones are struggling to keep pace, what does it say about the general state of workplace satisfaction?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, if even the good ones are struggling to keep pace, what does it say about the general state of workplace satisfaction?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, clearly, it's not all about the bottom line for employees anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, clearly, it's not all about the bottom line for employees anymore.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. It's the culture, the growth, the balance...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. It's the culture, the growth, the balance...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Maybe it ties back to that 'two jobs' idea from the article â€“ helping others *and* your actual job.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Maybe it ties back to that two jobs idea from the article - helping others and your actual job.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Why We All Need To Work Two Jobs Your first job is to help other people. Your second is your actual job.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's, like, a whole other conversation, but it definitely resonates here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's, like, a whole other conversation, but it definitely resonates here.
